dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Trademark Misappropriations]
dmca.body:
T

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of The Planet
Policy Enforcement
Posted At: Tuesday, June 13, 2006 1:41 PM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Trademark Misappropriations]
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Trademark Misappropriations]


-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the address
of copyright@theplanet.com.


- -------- Original Message --------
Subject:         [ABUSE] Trademark Misappropriations
Date:         Tue, 13 Jun 2006 11:53:06 -0600
From:         Libby Hill <Libby.Hill@xango.net>
To:         <ghannum@diamondcs.net>
CC:         abuse@theplanet.com



June 13, 2006



_VIA E-MAIL: ghannum@diamondcs.net_

Original to Follow Via Certified Mail



Grant Hannum

2012 Wisconsin Street Apt. #3

Midland, MI 48642



Re:       Trademark Misappropriations

            Our File:  10356



Dear Mr. Hannum:



It has come to our attention that you are engaged in a business enterprise that is
unlawfully misappropriating our corporate trademark.
Our Distributor Education and Conduct Department has made several attempts to
contact you prior to this correspondence but currently the issues remain unresolved.
 Consequently, we demand that you immediately cease and desist from any and all uses
of the XanGo? trademark.



Specifically, your websites www.xangomainia.com and www.wangoxango.com violate the
policy set forth in the Policies and Procedures Manual, Section 49-a, which reads:
?An Independent Distributor may not use the name ?XanGo?? in a business name, email
address, website domain name or sub-domain name, telephone number, or in any other
way other than in advertising text referring to the Company or to the product.? 
Clearly you are attempting to capitalize on the goodwill of our XanGo? trademark and
profit from the power of our trademark as a source identifier in violation of this
policy and intellectual property law.



Please be advised that we have protectable rights in the XANGO trademark and your
actions violate a number of federal and state laws, including but not limited to
Section 43 of the Lanham Act, 15 U.S.C.
